prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: My client. The only thing I can recall is that she's a policewoman.
Character 1
Name: Dustin Prince
Description: The victim, and a policeman. It seems that he was dating the defendant, Maggey Byrde.
Character 2
Name: Winston Payne
Description: The prosecutor for this case. Lacks presence. Generally bad at getting his points across.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maya
Description: I don't remember who she is, but I get the feeling I know her...
Character 5
Name: Richard Wellington
Description: A self-proclaimed "Drifting Virtuoso" who is still looking for the "right" college.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Cell Phone
Description: I found this in my pocket, but I don't remember what it means or how it got there. Maggey found this in the park. She got in contact with its owner, but they never showed.
Evidence 2
Name: Dustin's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 9/6 at 6:28 PM. Cause: Broken neck. Body was also covered in bruises.
Evidence 3
Name: Glasses
Description: Found under the victim's body. Pieces of near-sighted lenses were found nearby.
Evidence 4
Name: Crime Photo 1
Description: The victim fell from the walking path above. The photo shows the body of Dustin Prince as he was found after being pushed from the upper area of the park. There is a phone booth in the background.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Photo 2
Description: A photo of the area around the victim's hand. It shows the body of Dustin Prince having written 'Maggie' in the sand.
Evidence 6
Name: Baseball Glove
Description: A birthday present from Maggey to the victim. It was custom-made. [caption] It was made to be worn on the right hand. Looks kind of like a banana.
Evidence 7
Name: Phoenix's Business Card
Description: It's my business card. I handwrote my cell phone number on the back.
Evidence 8
Name: Names List
Description: A list of unfamiliar names and phone numbers. Members of a con artists' group...? A list of con artists and their phone numbers stored on the cell phone Maggey found.
Evidence 9
Name: Judge's Business Card
Description: It's written in fancy script. The ink is strong and clear, but I still can't read it.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: We first looked into the handwriting.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: Unfortunately, we couldn't confirm that it was the victim's handwriting.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: Next, we checked the victim's pointer finger.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: We found that there was sand trapped under the victim's fingernail.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: There were also scratches on the skin that were caused by him writing on the ground.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 5
Testimony: From this, we could confirm that the victim wrote this name with his right hand.
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: Evidence 6 shows a baseball glove that was a birthday present from Maggey to Dustin and it was made to be worn on the right hand. According to Testimony 5, Gumshoe confirms that the victim wrote the name in the sand with his right hand. However, if Dustin was wearing the glove on his right hand at the time he wrote with that hand, it would likely inhibit his ability to write clearly. This suggests a contradiction between the evidence of the glove being worn on the right hand and the testimony stating that Dustin wrote with his right hand (presumably unencumbered).

Characters:

Character 2

Character 3

Character 4

Character 5

Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1

Description: I found this in my pocket, but I don't remember what it means or how it got there. Maggey found this in the park. She got in contact with its owner, but they never showed.
Evidence 2
Name: Dustin's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 9/6 at 6:28 PM. Cause: Broken neck. Body was also covered in bruises.
Evidence 3
Name: Glasses
Description: Found under the victim's body. Pieces of near-sighted lenses were found nearby.
Evidence 4
Name: Crime Photo 1
Description: The victim fell from the walking path above. The photo shows the body of Dustin Prince as he was found after being pushed from the upper area of the park. There is a phone booth in the background.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Photo 2
Description: A photo of the area around the victim's hand. It shows the body of Dustin Prince having written 'Maggie' in the sand.
Evidence 6
Name: Baseball Glove
Description: A birthday present from Maggey to the victim. It was custom-made. [caption] It was made to be worn on the right hand. Looks kind of like a banana.
Evidence 7
Name: Phoenix's Business Card
Description: It's my business card. I handwrote my cell phone number on the back.
Evidence 8
Name: Names List
Description: A list of unfamiliar names and phone numbers. Members of a con artists' group...? A list of con artists and their phone numbers stored on the cell phone Maggey found.
Evidence 9
Name: Judge's Business Card
Description: It's written in fancy script. The ink is strong and clear, but I still can't read it.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was at the park all afternoon, deep in thought about my life situation.
Person: Wellington
Testimony 1
Testimony: I don't remember the time all that well, but I do believe it was past 6 PM.
Person: Wellington
Testimony 2
Testimony: All of a sudden, a police officer falls from above, right in front of my eyes.
Person: Wellington
Testimony 3
Testimony: Without a thought, I looked up, and there I met the eyes of a charming, young lady.
Person: Wellington
Testimony 4
Testimony: Of course I remember her sweet face. It was that of the pretty defendant there.
Person: Wellington
Testimony 5
Testimony: The only other thing I saw was the banana that fell with the police officer.
Person: Wellington

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 6 states that the baseball glove was made to be worn on the right hand. Testimony 5 says that Wellington saw a "banana" fall with the police officer, likely referring to the glove. If the glove was on the right hand, and Dustin fell from above, it's possible that the glove would not have fallen with him in a way observable by Wellington or that the glove being described as falling is at odds with the glove's characteristics. However, this is a subtle contradiction.

More clearly, Testimony 1 states that Wellington believes the event happened "past 6 PM," while Evidence 2 gives a specific time of death at 6:28 PM. This aligns well and is not contradictory. Testimony 0 says Wellington was at the park all afternoon, which is vague and does not conflict directly.

Testimony 3 says Wellington looked up and met the eyes of a "charming, young lady" right after the fall. Since Maggey is the defendant and a policewoman, that's plausible.

Testimony 4 states Wellington remember the "pretty defendant" clearly. No conflict there.

Testimony 2 says "a police officer falls from above, right in front of my eyes," which aligns with the crime's nature.

Evidence 1 says that Maggey found the cell phone in the park and made contact with its owner, but they never showed. No direct contradiction here.

Evidence 8 indicates a list of con artists from the cell phone found by Maggey, no contradiction.

Evidence 5 is a photo showing "Maggie" written in the sand near the victim's hand. No direct contradiction to any testimony.

The contradiction seems to be between Testimony 5 (Wellington saying, "The only other thing I saw was the banana that fell with the police officer") and Evidence 6 (The glove was made for the right hand). If Wellington saw the glove fall as part of the event from above but the glove was custom-made for the right hand, it suggests the glove was on the victimâ€™s hand during the fall. However, if the glove was still on the hand, would it fall separately? The slipping or falling of the glove might conflict with how it was found. 

Since only one contradiction is requested, I will select the pair that shows Wellington describing "the banana that fell," which likely refers to the baseball glove (from Evidence 6), which might conflict in the manner or timing.

cot: Evidence 2, Dustin's Autopsy Report, states that the time of death was at 6:28 PM. However, Testimony 2 from Wellington alleges that he made the call about the crime at 6:45 PM, which implies he noticed the crime after this time. This timing contradicts the time of death, as the report indicates Dustin Prince was already dead before Wellington's reported call time. Therefore, the timing of the call and the time of death do not match up logically.
